title: Basic Science Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic science concepts

questions.question: What is H2O?
questions.explanation: H2O is the chemical formula for water, consisting of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

questions.question: What planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: What is the speed of light?
questions.explanation: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 300,000 kilometers per second.

title: Mathematics Fundamentals
description: Basic mathematics questions for all levels

questions.question: What is the square root of 144?
questions.explanation: The square root of 144 is 12, since 12 × 12 = 144.

questions.question: What is the value of π (pi) approximately?
questions.explanation: Pi (π) is approximately 3.14159, commonly rounded to 3.14.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Germany in May and Japan in September.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington was the first President of the United States, serving from 1789 to 1797.

questions.question: When did the French Revolution begin?
questions.explanation: The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille on July 14.
